did.unittitle: Charles Simler Civil War discharge papers
did.abstract: This collection contains two Civil War discharges issued to Charles Simler (or Simbler) from the 56th Regiment of the New York State National Guard in 1863 and 1865 and three tintype photographs of members of the Simler family.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The documents from this collection are housed in a single folder. The tintypes are housed separately with other tintype photographs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Charles Simler Civil War discharge papers, 1977.531, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. In 2011 it was noted that daguerreotypes of Charles Simler, his wife, and his son were donated with these papers, but could not be located. In 2022 three tintype photographs of the family were located. These were assumed to be the images described as daguerreotypes in the accession file and were intellectually linked to this collection. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two Civil War discharges issued to Charles Simler (or Simbler) from the 56th Regiment of the New York State National Guard in 1863 and 1865. Simler reenlisted after his first discharge in 1863. The documents are signed by Mustering Officers Captain P. Hanson of Brooklyn (1863) and Lieutenant M. Dolan of Hart Island in New York Harbor (1865). The collection also include three tintype photographs of Simler, his wife, and his son.
